text: Ness City is a city in Ness County, Kansas, United States. It is also the county seat of Ness County. In 2020, 1,329 people lived there. Ness City is famous for its four-story Old Ness County Bank Building in downtown, and nicknamed Skyscraper of the Plains. ==History== Ness City was created in 1878. The town grew a lot when a railroad was built there in 1886. ==Geography== Ness City is at (38.454055, -99.904656). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. ==Weather== ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 1,329 people, 595 households, and 340 families living in Ness City. Of the households, 79.5% owned their home and 20.5% rented their home. The median age was 48.8 years. Of the people, 86.1% were White, 0.6% were Native American, 0.1% were Black, 8.2% were from some other race, and 5.0% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 14.1% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 1,449 people, 635 households, and 392 families living in Ness City. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * City of Ness City * Ness City - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 303, local school district * Sacred Heart Catholic School , local Catholic school, grades PS-8 ;Maps * Ness City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Ness County, Kansas Category:County seats in Kansas
title: Ness City, Kansas
